Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the impact of the Wall Street investors going bust in the 38 Studios deal.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack sufficient evidence to support the assertion that Wall Street investors went bust in the 38 Studios deal.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Wall Street investors were the ones who went bust in the 38 Studios deal without providing clear evidence or alternative explanations.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the failure of the 38 Studios deal, such as mismanagement or other factors unrelated to Wall Street investors.
